greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals: row m (m >= 1) satisfies b(0) = b(1) = 1; b(n) = m*b(n-1) + b(n-2):
comment: For n > 1, the number of independent vertex sets in the graph K_m X P_{n-1}. For example, in K_3 X P_1 there are 4 independent vertex sets. - _Andrew Howroyd_, May 23 2017
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
formula: O.g.f. row m: (mx-x-1)/(x^2+mx-1). - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 21 2008
maple: A135597 := proc(m,c) coeftayl( (m*x-x-1)/(x^2+m*x-1),x=0,c) ; end: for d from 1 to 15 do for c from 0 to d-1 do printf("%d,",A135597(d-c,c)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 21 2008
mathematica: a[_, 0] = a[_, 1] = 1; a[m_, n_] := m*a[m, n-1] + a[m, n-2]; Table[a[m-n+1, n], {m, 0, 11}, {n, 0, m}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 20 2014 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 02 2008
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 21 2008
